text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to mcmcr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to mcmcr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Manipulate MCMC Samples
text: mcmcr R package manipulate Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) samples.

title: Manipulate MCMC Samples
text: purposes discussion, MCMC sample represents value term single iteration single chain. simple parameter intercept corresponds single term, complex parameters interaction two factors consists multiple terms inherent dimensionality - case matrix. set MCMC samples can stored different ways.

title: Manipulate MCMC Samples
text: three common S3 classes store MCMC samples follows: coda::mcmc stores MCMC samples single chain matrix row represents iteration column represents variable coda::mcmc.list stores multiple mcmc objects (identical dimensions) list object represents parallel chain rjags::mcarray stores samples single parameter initial dimensions parameter dimensions, second last dimension iterations last dimension chains. first two cases terms/parameters represented single dimension means dimensionality inherent parameters stored labelling variables, ie, "bIntercept", "bInteraction[1,2]", "bInteraction[2,1]", .... structure mcmc mcmc.list objects emphasizes time-series nature MCMC samples optimized thining. contrast mcarray objects preserve dimensionality parameters.

title: Manipulate MCMC Samples
text: mcmcr package defines three related S3 classes also preserve dimensionality parameters: mcmcr::mcmcarray similar rjags::mcarray except first dimension chains, second dimension iterations subsequent dimensions represent dimensionality parameter (called mcmcarray emphasize MCMC dimensions ie chains iterations come first); mcmcr::mcmcr stores multiple uniquely named mcmcarray objects number chains iterations. mcmcr::mcmcrs stores multiple mcmcr objects parameters, chains iterations. five classes (mcmc, mcmc.list, mcarray, mcmcarray, mcmcr mcmcrs) collectively referred MCMC objects.

title: Manipulate MCMC Samples
text: mcmcarray objects developed facilitate manipulation MCMC samples. mcmcr objects developed allow set dimensionality preserving parameters single analysis manipulated whole. mcmcrs objects developed allow results multiple analyses using model manipulated together. mcmcr package (together term nlist packages) introduces variety (often) generic functions manipulate query mcmcarray, mcmcr mcmcrs objects (term nlist nlists objects). particular provides functions coerce mcarray, mcmc mcmc.list objects; extract objects coef table (tibble); query object’s nchains, niters, term::npars, term::nterms, nlist::nsims nlist::nsams well ’s parameter dimensions (term::pdims) term indices (term::tindex); subset objects chains, iterations /parameters; bind_xx pair objects xx_chains, xx_iterations, xx_parameters (parameter) xx_dimensions; combine samples two () MCMC objects using combine_samples (combine_samples_n) combine samples single MCMC object reducing dimensions using combine_dimensions; collapse_chains split_chains object’s chains; mcmc_map objects values; transpose objects parameter dimensions using mcmc_aperm; assess object converged using rhat esr (effectively sampling rate); course thin, rhat, ess (effective sample size), print, plot etc said objects. code opinionated advantage providing small set stream-lined functions. example ‘convergence’ metric uncorrected, untransformed, univariate split R-hat (potential scale reduction factor). can convince additional features important add accept pull request (see ). Alternatively might want use mcmcr package manipulate samples coercing mcmc.list take advantage summary functions packages coda.

title: Parameter descriptions — params
text: x object. scalar logical scalar specifying whether include parameters (NULL), scalars (TRUE) parameters except scalars (FALSE). terms logical scalar specifying whether provide parameters term. nas flag specifying whether also fill missing values. nthin positive integer thinning rate. string indicating whether determine "term", "parameter" "". as_df flag indicating whether return results data frame versus named list. fun function given numeric vector returns numeric scalar. bound flag specifying whether bind mcmcrs objects chains calculating rhat. rhat maximum rhat value. esr minimum effective sampling rate. na_rm flag specifying whether ignore missing values. parameters character vector (NULL) parameters subset . iterations integer vector (NULL) iterations subset . ... Unused. x2 second MCMC object. x_name string name object. error flag indicating whether throw informative error immediately generate informative message check fails. sorted flag specifying whether parameters must sorted. object MCMC object get coefficients conf_level number specifying confidence level. default 0.95. estimate function use calculate estimate. simplify flag specifying whether return just estimate, lower, upper svalue. perm integer vector new order parameter dimensions. pars character vector (NULL) pars zero. name string specifying parameter name.

title: mcmcr 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-06 Update testing testthat 3.

title: mcmcr 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-05 Added fill_na() mcarray, mcmcarray mcmcr. Fixed .mcmcarray.mcmc() (.mcmcr.mcmc()) now returns mcmcarray (mcmcr) object terms.

title: mcmcr 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-11 tidy.mcmcr(). simplify = FALSE argument coef() tidy() soft-deprecated TRUE. ... optional arguments fun = median argument estimates(). Moved as_nlists.mcmc.list() nlist package.

title: mcmcr 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-27 Added as_mcmc_list.mcmr(). as_nlist.mcmc() as_nlist.mcmc.list() as_nlists.mcmc() .term.mcmc() .term.mcmc.list() bind_iterations.mcmc() bind_iterations.mcmc.list() collapse_chains.default() collapse_chains.mcmc.list()

title: mcmcr 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-13 npdims.mcmc.list() return character vector (opposed list) collapse_chains.mcmc.list() return mcmc.list object one chain (opposed mcmc object) first argument estimates() object x. scalar_only = FALSE argument pars() scalar = NA. estimates() now checks fun returns scalar numeric. pvalue() extras::pvalue(). zero() fill_all(). check_mcmcarray() check_mcmcr() chk_mcmcarray() chk_mcmcr(). iterations argument iters subset(). parameters argument pars subset(). vld_() chk_() functions mcmcarray mcmcr objects. scalar = NULL argument pars() npars(). na_rm = NA argument esr() rhat(). missing as_df = FALSE arg esr() mcarray, mcmc mcmc.list. coercion nlists objects mcmcr, mcmc.list mcmc objects. handling terms term package. generic definitions nchains(), niters(), collapse_chains() split_chains() etc universals package.

title: mcmcr 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-06-27 Added check_mcmcr() check_mcmcarray(). Fixed as_df arguments converged(). Added tests. Removed .mcmc.mcmc.list(), thin.mcmc() thin.mcmc.list() now defined coda. longer export .mcmc.list.mcarray() clashes rjags version.

title: mcmcr 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-04-26 Added mcmc_aperm() function transpose parameter dimensions. Added npdims() function get number parameter dimensions. Added = TRUE argument mcmc_map() function. Removed tibble package suggests. rhat() now returns minimum 1. Defined subset() parameters() mcmcrs object. Added bound = FALSE argument rhat.mcmcrs() converged.mcmcrs() functions.

title: mcmcr 0.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2018-11-24 Moved graphics, coef, tibble packages imports suggests. Replaced internal error() err::err().

title: mcmcr 0.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-10-30 Allowed NAs values calculate pvalues. Updated use length argument checkr deprecated.

title: mcmcr 0.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-04-13 Released CRAN.
